attributes.action: Ban fur and foie gras imports
attributes.additional_details:
The production of fur and foie gras causes suffering and by allowing the products to be imported the UK is enabling that cruelty.

Ministers should be focused on other issues facing the country rather than considering dropping the proposed ban and continuing to allow cruelly made items into the country.

Personal choice over what we buy is one thing but enabling animal cruelty is quite another. The ban should be implemented and our stance against animal cruelty made firm.
attributes.background: It has been widely reported that the UK Government is considering dropping plans to ban imports of fur and foie gras. We want the Government to confirm that the Animal Abroad Bill will include provisions to ban the import of fur and foie gras to the UK.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
